xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 23 July 2013
xwikidoc.content: <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 05:35 <mcupak> hey sdumitriu 06:06 <mcupak> sdumitriu: when you're here, could you please quickly check what happened on medsavant master? 06:07 <mcupak> sdumitriu: I unintentionally ran git push on all my branches, which generated the commits listed above on master - not sure what actually happened, it's probably just a merge of other people's changes, but it seems kind of weird so I just want to be sure I didn't damage anything 06:50 <sdumitriu> Hey mcupak 06:50 <sdumitriu> Checking 07:00 <sdumitriu> mcupak: I reverted your push 07:01 <sdumitriu> There was only one actual commit, and a bunch of merges after that, some of which introduced conflicts 07:01 <sdumitriu> You should discard your master branch and switch to the official master 07:46 <mcupak> thanks, and sorry about that 07:46 <mcupak> I was actually only trying to push to my fork on a different branch, but something went wrong 07:47 <mcupak> whenever I feel I have git at least slightly figured out, it surprises me like this :-/ 08:03 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 08:52 <bvancea> hey sdumitriu 08:52 <sdumitriu> Hey bvancea 08:53 <bvancea> I'm trying to think of a way to handle the insertion of entities 08:53 <bvancea> in the abstraction layer 08:53 <bvancea> since JPQL does not provide support for insert statements 08:53 <bvancea> do you have any ideas? 08:54 <sdumitriu> Two things 08:55 <sdumitriu> One, don't use JPQL but something from JPA 08:55 <sdumitriu> Two, add our own INSERT statement 08:55 <sdumitriu> But I don't like 2 that much 08:55 <sdumitriu> If we do work with entities, we should just have a way to store entities 08:55 <sdumitriu> INSERT statements are too low level 08:56 <bvancea> yeah 08:56 <sdumitriu> INSERT is targeting rows and columns 08:56 <sdumitriu> And by moving to JPQL we're trying to switch to entities 08:57 <bvancea> true 08:57 <bvancea> JPA uses the EntityManager for persistence 08:58 <bvancea> unlike HQL, which adds an insert statement 08:59 <sdumitriu> I like the persist(Object) API 08:59 <bvancea> me too, its simpler 08:59 <sdumitriu> I wonder how well does it behave with a million objects 08:59 <sdumitriu> We'd probably have to add an autocommit or something 09:00 <sdumitriu> So that we don't fill up the memory 09:00 <sdumitriu> (when working with ICE) 09:00 <sdumitriu> Solr has autocommit already 09:00 <sdumitriu> I mean, in Solr we can't have transactions 09:00 <sdumitriu> Hm, or no 09:01 <sdumitriu> Discard that 09:01 <sdumitriu> Transactions are handled by the database, we just send data to the database, and the database isn't stupid enough to hold everything in memory 09:01 <sdumitriu> Gotta go to the lab, ttyl 09:01 <bvancea> kk 09:30 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 09:59 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 10:00 <misko_> has joined #medsavant 11:58 <mcupak> has joined #medsavant 14:19 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 14:34 <sdumitriu1> New in Solr 4.4: schemaless mode 14:44 <marta> bea tu 14:45 <marta> sorry, wrong chat :D 14:52 <bvancea> sdumitriu: nice 14:53 <bvancea> they've been saying they want to include that in a future release 14:54 <bvancea> wonder if its stable 14:55 <bvancea> they seem to have removed the solr 3.6 link from the website, only the 4.4 link there now 15:55 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant
